page.title: 11LLANSTEFFAN AREA: SUPPLIES
page.content: Llanybri has a pub, The Farmers Arms, and a combined post office and general shop, and a craft potter. Llansteffan has a post office and shop, grocer, butcher-baker-greengrocer, sweetshop, two hairdressers, an agricultural and motor mechanic, 2 coal merchants one of whom also sells bottled gas and building materials, and 2 pubs, The Sticks and The Castle. For summer visitors The Green has a small shop-cum-cafe and 2 stalls selling "fast food" (mainly fish and chips) and ice cream. Milk is delivered to every house in both villages. A visiting baker, greengrocer, grocer and a laundry travel round by van. The County Library van tours Llansteffan twice monthly and Llanybri once monthly. The shops sell newspapers; the Western Mail is popular.
